pros: The strength of Michener is its dedicated staff.  It focuses solely on applied health sciences, with two of its programs being the only programs of their kind in Ontario.  Students like the small class sizes and the opportunity to get to know their professors.
cons: Very hierarchical in structure.  Management seldom asks for input from those at the front line, or for feedback on employee satisfaction.  Declining enrolment and job opportunities in healthcare places Michener in a precarious position as it has many larger competitors. Michener is unique in that it is publicly funded by the Ministry of Health & Long Term Care. Competitor schools are funded by Ministry of Training, Colleges & Universities.

review_title: A niche school with a great reputation
job_title: Director of Marketing and Communications in Toronto, ON
pros: Being a smaller organization, there is a very caring culture ... but being part of University Health Network, there are many opportunities to learn and grow.  Benefits are excellent.
cons: Pay could be more competitive, and being smaller, there are fewer opportunities for growth within the school.
